name: unsuspicious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
trusting someone or something, or not realizing the truth about a situation : Because of his unsuspicious nature and high self-confidence, he reacted calmly to criticism.unsuspicious of When they arrived, they found a population that was unarmed and unsuspicious of danger. Opposite
suspicious
More examplesFewer examplesUnsuspicious consumers are handing over cash for what turns out to be an empty promise.She knew nothing of their intentions, and was wholly unsuspicious of any danger to her daughter.Mr Weston was perfectly unsuspicious of the anger he was causing, and was as happy and cheerful as usual.
